sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a Windows program executable started from a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

match_context.values: @{SourceIsIpv6=true; DestinationPort=53; DestinationIp=808:808:0:0:0:0:0:0; Protocol=udp; SourceIp=c0a8:20b:0:0:8891:c6e1:8b9:ffff; DestinationIsIpv6=true; EventID=3; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; SourcePort=60201; Initiated=true}

@{SourceIsIpv6=false; DestinationPort=443; Initiated=true; Protocol=tcp; SourceIp=192.168.2.11; DestinationIsIpv6=false; EventID=3; SourcePort=49728; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe; DestinationIp=5.9.123.217}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe to launch arbitrary commands or binaries,
which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer spawning from "svchost"
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), @gott_cyber

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; OriginalFileName=EXPLORER.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=E3E4340C0C5190EA2B39DF43C00786BC3FD21681,MD5=2C1C37277E41F3A71A4FC1EBDA5BD708,SHA256=9DD5E765587FD0ABAAD22ADE578ADB38A2E032DD38F00EDD7A1BDD691635D522,IMPHASH=CDA5280A62F22D7E6A2E37DD63404B26; Description=Windows Explorer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k DcomLaunch -p; CommandLine=C:\Windows\explorer.exe /factory,{75dff2b7-6936-4c06-a8bb-676a7b00b24b} -Embedding; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1276 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

names: Essay on Resolution of Korean Forced Labor Claims.vbs

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (1455u), with CRLF line terminators
attributes.meaningful_name: Essay on Resolution of Korean Forced Labor Claims.vbs

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )

alert tls $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET INFO TLS Handshake Failure"; flow:established,to_client; dsize:7; content:"|15|"; depth:1; content:"|00 02 02 28|"; distance:2; within:4; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2029340; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2020_01_30, deployment Perimeter, former_category INFO, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2020_01_30;)

alert tls any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA TLS invalid record type"; flow:established; app-layer-event:tls.invalid_record_type; flowint:tls.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2230002; rev:1;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: SURICATA Applayer Wrong direction first Data
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ip any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA Applayer Wrong direction first Data"; flow:established; app-layer-event:applayer_wrong_direction_first_data; flowint:applayer.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2260001; rev:1;)
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )
